article_metadata.description: In an infuriating display of stubbornness, Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell (R–Ky.) refuses to hold hearings on President Barack Obama’s Supreme Court nominee Merrick Garland, citing that the American people deserve to have a say in this process. The thing is, they did. A little less than four years ago, President Obama won reelection. The American people elected him to perform the tasks and duties set out for him by the Constitution, which specifically includes nominating justices to the Supreme Court.

og.title: Op-Ed: Do your democratic job
